events.1509: Don Francis-Di-Almeda of Portugal was succeeded as the Viceroy of Protuguese India by Affonso de Albuquerque, who is regarded as the real founder at Portuguese power in India.
events.1556: Mughals, under the leadership of Akbar, defeated Hindu ruler Hemu in the second battle of Panipat.
events.1870: Chittaranjan Das, freedom fighter, famous lawyer and orator, was born at Calcutta.
events.1892: John Burdon Sanderson Haldane, biologist, was born at Oxford.
events.1906: Initials of the place of issuance of notes were started to be printed instead of Issuing Circle's name.
events.1907: Special commissioner appointed to deal with famine conditions.
events.1915: Balasaheb Devras, sar sanghchalak of RSS, was born.
events.1920: Indian Red Cross society was founded in India under Bengal Act VIII. St.John Ambulance Association is a wing of this societywhich directed Improvement of Health, Prevention of Diseases and Mitigation of Suffering activities.
events.1927: Lord Irwin, Viceroy of India, met Gandhiji, S.Shriniwas Iyengar and M.A. Ansari Congress leaders at New Delhi.
events.1928: R. V. S. Perishastri, former Chief Election Commissioner of India, was born.
events.1929: Narottam Morarjee, great social reformer and the architect of the modern Indian Shipping, died.
events.1930: Arjun Singh, leader of Madhya Pradesh, was born.
events.1931: M. G. Subramaniam, cricket test umpire for 2 tests from 1983-84, was born in Karnataka.
events.1945: Case was filed against the Azad Hind Army Soldiers at Red Fort in Delhi.
events.1950: Faiyaj Khan, famous singer of Indian classical music, died.
events.1951: Western Railways and Central Railways were formed in Bombay; seperate Time Tables were setup.
events.1956: University Grants Commission Act sets up UGC.
events.1961: Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru arrived in New York. This was the first ocassion when an Indian Prime Minister went to United States.
events.1976: Lok Sabha votes to extend its own life by another year.
events.1977: Indira Gandhi arrested and released unconditionally. The External Affairs Minister, Atal Bihari Vajpayee addresses the United Nations General Assembly in Hindi.
events.1990: Janata Dal splits. The breakaway group claims support of 58 M.P.'s to elect Mr. Chandrashekhar as leader. V.P. Singh's government loses confidence motion in the Lok Sabha.
events.1994: Russi Modi appointed Chairman of Air India and Indian Airlines.
events.1995: Narsimha Rao, PM, reaches Argentina for G-15 summit at Buenos Aires.
events.1996: United Front suffers a setback with one of its constituents, the Madhya Pradesh Vikas party, deciding to walk out and merge with Congress (I).
events.1997: Railway ministry doubles compensation amounts from Rs. 2 lakh to Rs.4 lakh to victims of railway accidents and other untoward incidents.
events.1998: Baba Nagarjun "Vaidyanath Mishra" died. He wrote in Hindi, Maithali and Sanskrit. Some of his noted works are "Patra-Heen- Nagna Gachh", "Dukhmochan", "Yugdhara" and "Sahath" "Pret Ka Bayan".
events.1999: The CBI arrests the Bihar Road Construction Minister Illiyas Hussain and conducts raids in the Bitumen scam case.
events.2000: The Interpol issues a "look-out'' notice for the five persons and two of their accomplices, who hijacked an Indian Airlines plane in December 1999.
